Description:
The ValueSet resource represents a subset of the codes in a code system that is supported by a given server. The $expand operation of the ValueSet resource can be used by a FHIR API consumer to determine:

  • What values to expect back from the server as a result of a Read or Search operation.
  • What values they can pass in to the server when performing a Create or Update operation.

The $expand operation response represents a single ValueSet resource.

Epic currently supports querying the ValueSet.$expand operation with search parameters. For example, a client may perform a query in the format /ValueSet/$expand?parameter=value.

Epic does not support querying the ValueSet.$expand operation for a specific identifier (/ValueSet/[id]/$expand).

The following resources are currently supported for use with the ValueSet.$expand operation. Additional resources will be supported in future versions.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic: DocumentReference

context.Name: context
context.Description:
The path to the element in the resource.

  • Expected format: <ResourceName>.<ElementPath>
  • Example: DocumentReference.type

Epic currently supports the following contexts:

  • DocumentReference.type
  • DocumentReference.docStatus

contextdirection.Name: contextdirection
contextdirection.Description:
Specifies the direction of the interaction with regards to the ValueSet. Options include "outgoing" or "incoming".

  • outgoing - for query parameters and response content
  • incoming - for incoming POST/PUT body

filter.Name: filter
filter.Description:
A filter string used to further refine the ValueSet context to a specific sub-resource based on the resource's category element, and in some cases, additional details.

  • Example: filter=category:document-information,workflow:registration, level:encounter,resource:ej5R7X.4RdaFNR5vWdsTpVTtccmkRkWJcKixc5XVY4cQ3

Epic currently supports the following filters:

  • category:clinical-note
  • category:document-information

The following additional filters can be combined with category:document-information to further refine results:

  • workflow:general
  • workflow:registration
  • level:patient
  • level:encounter
  • level:order
  • resource:<patient FHIR ID>
  • resource:<encounter FHIR ID>

contains.Name: contains
contains.Description: Array of codes in the ValueSet.

display.Name: display
display.Description: User display value associated with the code.

parameter.Name: parameter
parameter.Description: Parameter that controlled the expansion process.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Parameter name as assigned by the client or server.

timestamp.Name: timestamp
timestamp.Description: Time that the ValueSet expansion occurred.

total.Name: total
total.Description: Total number of codes in the expansion.
